title: Quiz 4: Crisis Intervention Skills
description: Test your ability to identify crisis situations like suicide or substance abuse and apply intervention skills.

questions.question: Which of the following are verbal cues of suicidal ideation?

options.text: "The world would be better off without me"

questions.explanation: Verbal cues express hopelessness or a desire to end life.

questions.question: Arrange the steps for responding to suicidal ideation in the correct order:

items.text: Take it seriously and stay calm
Ask direct questions (Do you have a plan?)

questions.explanation: First acknowledge and calm, then assess risk, ensure physical safety, and finally connect to professional help.
questions.hint: Safety and assessment come before referral.

questions.question: ___BLANK___ is the process of fully concentrating, understanding, responding, and remembering what the other person is saying.
questions.explanation: Active listening is a key crisis intervention skill involving full attention and reflection.

questions.question: In a substance abuse crisis, what is the definition of an 'Overdose'?

richContent.content: Warning Signs: Breathing difficulties, unconsciousness, heart failure.

options.text: Physical symptoms when stopping substance use
A life-threatening situation from consuming excess substance

questions.explanation: Overdose is a life-threatening situation caused by excessive consumption, leading to severe physical reactions.

questions.question: Match the De-escalation Technique to its example:

pairs.right: "I understand this is difficult for you"
"Would you prefer to sit or stand?"
"I need you to lower your voice"

questions.explanation: These techniques help calm an agitated individual.
questions.hint: Match the strategy to the specific phrase used.

questions.question: When de-escalating an aggressive individual, it is best to stand very close to them to show dominance.
questions.explanation: You should maintain a safe distance and avoid physical confrontation or threatening body language.
questions.hint: Is crowding an angry person safe?

questions.question: Which of the following is a physical symptom of substance abuse crisis?
questions.explanation: Dilated pupils, slurred speech, and vomiting are physical symptoms. Mood swings are behavioral; decision making is cognitive.
questions.hint: Which option describes a bodily function?

questions.question: What is the term for the set of strategies aimed at reducing the intensity of a crisis and calming an individual?
questions.explanation: De-escalation refers to techniques used to calm a situation and prevent harm.
questions.hint: It means to 'lower' the scale of the conflict.

questions.question: Which of the following should you DO during Active Listening? (Select all that apply)

options.text: Pay full attention and make eye contact

questions.explanation: Active listening involves attention, open-ended questions, and summarizing. Interrupting is discouraged.
questions.hint: Select actions that show you are listening, not talking.

questions.question: What is 'Crisis Stabilization'?

options.text: Quickly managing immediate distress to ensure safety
Ignoring the crisis until it passes
Finding a job for the patient

questions.explanation: Crisis stabilization focuses on managing immediate distress and ensuring safety before long-term work begins.
